circuit_intent.description: Minimal ESP32-C3 core circuit powered from an external regulated 3.3V supply, with basic power filtering/decoupling and a UART header suitable for flashing and serial debug. Includes common boot/enable strapping resistors for stable startup.

symbols.explanation: Main MCU providing Wi-Fi/BLE and application processing; ESP32-C3 chosen as the simplest available controller in the allowlist.
2-pin power input to supply the board from an external regulated 3.3V source plus ground, avoiding the need for an on-board regulator not present in the allowlist.
6-pin header intended for UART TX/RX plus 3V3, GND, and optional EN/BOOT signals to support flashing and serial debug with a USB-UART adapter.
Ferrite bead on the 3.3V feed to the MCU domain to reduce high-frequency noise; 600ohm@100MHz is a common default for small digital boards.
Bulk decoupling on the 3.3V rail near the MCU to handle transient current draw; 10uF is a typical starter value for ESP-class devices.
High-frequency decoupling capacitor for the MCU supply pins; 100nF is the standard value for local bypassing.
Pull-up resistor for the ESP32-C3 enable/reset (EN) line to ensure the chip comes out of reset reliably; 10k is a common default.
Default strap/pull resistor for a boot-related GPIO to bias the device toward normal boot; 10k is commonly used for strap pulls to minimize wasted current.
3.3V power net symbol required to define the regulated rail used by the ESP32-C3 and headers; footprint left empty because power symbols do not have PCB footprints.
Ground reference symbol required for any powered circuit; footprint left empty because power symbols do not have PCB footprints.
